Module JBubbleBobble2
Package BubbleBobble.model

Class Giant

java.lang.Object
BubbleBobble.model.Collidable
BubbleBobble.model.Monster
BubbleBobble.model.Giant
public class Giant extends Monster
MyMonster class extends the Monster class and represents a specific type of monster with unique behaviors, including shooting fireballs at random intervals, handling attacks, and drawing the attack count.

  • Field Details

    • count

      public int count

  • Constructor Details

    • Giant

      public Giant(Level level, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Constructor to initialize a MyMonster with specific position, size, and appearance. The monster will also have a randomized fireball interval between 4000 and 6000 milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      level - The level this monster belongs to.
      x - The x-coordinate of the monster.
      y - The y-coordinate of the monster.
      width - The width of the monster.
      height - The height of the monster.

  • Method Details

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the position of the monster, checking if it's time to shoot a fireball based on the random fireball interval.
      Overrides:
      updatePosition in class Monster

    • addToList

      public void addToList()
      Adds this monster to the level's list of monsters.
      Specified by:
      addToList in class Collidable

    • collideWithBubble

      public void collideWithBubble()
      Handles the collision of this monster with a bubble. The monster loses one attack count upon collision, and dies when the attack count reaches 0.
      Overrides:
      collideWithBubble in class Monster

    • collideWithFireBubble

      public void collideWithFireBubble(int type, Level level)
      Handles the collision of this monster with a fire bubble. The monster loses 3 attack counts upon collision. If the count reaches 0 or below, it dies and the level score is increased by 2000 for both players.
      Overrides:
      collideWithFireBubble in class Monster
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the fire bubble (1 for Hero, 2 for Player 2).
      level - The current game level.

    • shootFireball

      public void shootFireball()
      Shoots a fireball in the current direction. The fireball is added to the level.

    • drawAttackCount

      public void drawAttackCount(Graphics g)
      Draws the attack count on the screen above the monster's head.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object used to draw the attack count.
